body_html:
Interesting, when I try to uninstall and install PyTorch again, I get the following message:

conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /home/max/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_env:

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    pytorch:     0.1.12-py36cuda8.0cudnn6.0_1
    torchvision: 0.1.8-py36_0

Why would the conda have me installed the version 0.1.12-py36cuda8.0cudnn6.0_1? Is this normal?

body:
Interesting, when I try to uninstall and install PyTorch again, I get the following message:

```bash
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /home/max/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_env:

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    pytorch:     0.1.12-py36cuda8.0cudnn6.0_1
    torchvision: 0.1.8-py36_0
```

Why would the conda have me installed  the version `0.1.12-py36cuda8.0cudnn6.0_1`? Is this normal?
